message_1: A radioactive substance has a half-life of 10 days. If there are initially 100 grams of the substance, how many grams will be left after 30 days?
message_2:
To determine the amount of the radioactive substance remaining after 30 days, we can use the formula:

Final amount = Initial amount * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial amount is 100 grams, the time elapsed is 30 days, and the half-life is 10 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final amount = 100 * (1/2)^(30 / 10)
Final amount = 100 * (1/2)^3
Final amount = 100 * (1/8)
Final amount = 12.5 grams

So, after 30 days, there will be 12.5 grams of the radioactive substance remaining.
